docs.title: AI Innovation | Open Source Contributor | Building with AI 🚀
docs.text:
Welcome! Here, you can view my journey of learning, building and contributing to the ever-evolving world of Artificial Intelligence and Open Source.

I believe in creating impact through collaboration and innovation.

docs.title: About Me
docs.text:
I am always eager to collaborate on projects that allow me to apply my skills while deepening my understanding of the AI field. These experiences not only enhance my technical abilities but also provide valuable insights.

I look forward to connecting with fellow AI enthusiasts, researchers and professionals to explore new opportunities and collectively advance our application of AI.

docs.title: Technical Skills
docs.text:
• Programming Languages: Python, Bash, YAML
  • Frameworks & Libraries: PyTorch, Git, Jupyter Notebook, Makefile
  • Machine Learning: Model Optimization, Fine-Tuning
  • Writing & Communication: Effective Communication, Technical Writing

docs.title: Featured Projects 🛠️
docs.text:
Explore the intersection of my curiosity and execution:

1️⃣ SLM Experiments: Experiments to optimize performance and alignment of Small Language Models.

2️⃣ Bash Mastery: Learning shell scripting through real-world tasks and practical workflows.

3️⃣ Applied Papers: Re-implementation of seminal AI papers to gain fresh insights.

🎯 View All Projects

docs.title: Contributions
docs.text:
I enjoy contributing to leading open-source projects to improve documentation and codebases.

  • Hugging Face Diffusers: State-of-the-art diffusion models for image, video and audio generation in PyTorch and FLAX.
  • Lightning-AI LitGPT: 20+ high-performance LLMs with recipes to pretrain, finetune and deploy at scale.
  • LLM Datasets: High-quality datasets, tools and concepts for LLM fine-tuning.

📂 Explore My Contributions

docs.text:
I’m always looking forward to discuss ideas, collaborate on projects, or share insights.

docs.title: Education 🎓
docs.text: Bachelor of Technology in Artificial Intelligence & Data Science Dr. D.Y. Patil Vidyapeeth — Pune, India (2023 – 2027)

docs.title: Work Experience 💼
docs.text:
AI Research Intern — GreenPepper (Feb 2024 – Dec 2024)

Key Contributions:

  • Authored over five narrative reports that effectively explained business trends in Generative AI to stakeholders.
  • Conducted comprehensive analyses of research papers, business reports and scholarly articles, extracting valuable insights to lead decision-making.
  • Led the development of “The Generative AI Stack”, producing a detailed, 20+ page guide designed to drive innovation in business usecases.
  • Actively participated in the GenAI Sprint, focusing on researching AI applications in the medical domain.

docs.title: Courses & Certifications 📜
docs.text:
• Taking Python to Production: A Professional Onboarding Guide
  • Agile Fundamentals: Including Scrum & Kanban
  • Software Architecture & Design of Modern Large-Scale Systems
  • Understanding Quantum Computing
  • Git and GitHub

docs.title: Open-Source Contributions
docs.text: I enjoy contributing to open-source projects. My aim is to ensure better performance, usability and making technical information accessible.

docs.title: Lightning-AI/litgpt
docs.text: PR #1821: Removed support for 5+ obsolete LLM models. View Pull Request

docs.title: huggingface/notebooks
docs.text:
• PR #525: Added 15+ Jupyter notebooks for community scripts and pipelines.
  • PR #535, #527, #536: Further enhancements to notebooks. View Pull Requests

docs.title: huggingface/lighteval
docs.text: PR #433: Removed obsolete benchmark configuration properties. View Pull Request

docs.title: huggingface/diffusers
docs.text:
• PR #10094, #10032, #9952, #9905: Updated Jupyter notebook links for diffusers community pipelines.
  • PR #9940, #10117, #10105, #9935, #9960, #10063: Fixed broken links, updated missing documentation, and restructured script folders. View Pull Requests

docs.title: huggingface/notebooks
docs.text: PR #530: Fixed typos and broken links in community notebooks. View Pull Request

docs.title: mlabonne/llm-datasets
docs.text: • PR #6, #10: Added 6 LLM datasets related to general-purpose, math, logic, and citations. View Pull Requests

docs.title: Projects
docs.text: I believe that projects are the best way to apply and deepen knowledge. They allow me to bridge theoretical concepts with practical implementation. Each project fuels my curiosity and enhances my skills.

docs.title: 1️⃣ Bash Mastery
docs.text: "Mastering the command line, one script at a time." Learning shell scripting effectively by solving real-world tasks. - 📂 Explore topics like automation, file management, and system monitoring. - 🌟 Hands-on tasks include building efficient workflows and scripting utilities.

docs.title: 2️⃣ SLM Experiments
docs.text: "Optimizing Small Language Models for performance and alignment." A collection of experiments aimed at improving the efficiency and adaptability of SLMs. - 🔍 Focus on performance tuning, parameter adjustments, and task-specific fine-tuning. - 🧪 Results contribute to scalable, lightweight language model research.

docs.title: 3️⃣ Applied Papers
docs.text: "Turning research into actionable insights." Re-implementing groundbreaking research papers to uncover new perspectives. - 🧠 Dive into topics like model architectures, optimization techniques, and experimental setups. - 📜 Gain deeper insights by analyzing reproducibility and extending existing findings.

docs.title: Want to collaborate or share insights?
docs.text: 📫 Feel free to reach out via LinkedIn or explore my GitHub for more!
